intro: Jacquinia venosa, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes and coastal bluffs. It produces small, oval leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Jacquinia venosa is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
